poem:
**Franchised Futures**

Money flows,
a quiet storm
through paper gates,
while words crumble —
solders of ambition.

Language false,
a mirror's prank;
students tread
the thin ice
of promises.

Universities stand,
hollow columns,
guardians of
a truth outsourced.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. Research by the Office for Students (OfS) has raised multiple concerns about the growing enthusiasm for franchise partnerships in higher education, where a university contracts another organisation". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
